canonical_explanation.text: Numbers from 1 to 99 can be counted forward and backward. Each number has a numeral (like 45) and a name (like forty-five). One more means the next number when counting forward. One less means the number just before when counting backward.
rules: When counting forward, each number is one more than the previous number.
When counting backward, each number is one less than the previous number.
Two-digit numbers from 21 to 99 have a tens part and a ones part.
One more than a number means adding 1. One less means taking away 1.

questions.question_text: What number comes just after 5 when counting forward?
questions.explanation_correct: The number that comes just after 5 when counting forward is 6. When we count forward, each number is one more than the previous number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The number that comes just after 5 when counting forward is not 4, 7, or 3. These numbers are not the next number in the counting sequence. The correct answer is 6, because when we count forward from 5, the next number is 6.

questions.question_text: What number comes just after 19 when counting forward?
questions.explanation_correct: The number that comes just after 19 when counting forward is 20. When we count forward, each number is one more than the previous number, so 20 comes right after 19.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option C, 20, is the correct answer because when we count forward, each number is one more than the previous number. 19 comes before 20, so 20 is the number that comes just after 19. Options A, 18, and D, 17, are incorrect because they are numbers that come before 19 when counting forward.

questions.question_text: Count forward from 46. What are the next three numbers?
questions.explanation_correct: The next three numbers after 46 when counting forward are 47, 48, and 49. This is because each number is one more than the previous number, so 47 is one more than 46, 48 is one more than 47, and 49 is one more than 48.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 47, 48, 49. Option A is correct because when you count forward from 46, the next three numbers are 47, 48, and 49. Option B is wrong because it is counting backward, not forward. Option C is wrong because 50 is too high, and Option D is wrong because 51 is too high.

questions.question_text: Which set of numbers is in correct counting order?
questions.explanation_correct: The numbers in option B (71, 72, 73, 74) are in correct counting order. Each number is one more than the previous number, which is how numbers are counted when going forward.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The numbers in option A (55, 57, 56, 58) are not in correct counting order because the number 56 comes before 57, which is not the right way to count. The numbers in option C (30, 29, 31, 32) are also not in correct counting order because 29 comes before 30, which is not the right way to count. The numbers in option D (88, 90, 89, 91) are not in correct counting order because 89 comes before 90, which is not the right way to count.

questions.question_text: When counting backward from 10, what number comes after 10?
questions.explanation_correct: When counting backward from 10, the next number after 10 is 9. This is because 9 is the number that comes right before 10 when counting backward.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 9 because when you count backward from 10, you go 10, 9, 8, 7, and so on. Option A (11) is not the right answer because 11 is the number that comes after 10 when counting forward, not backward. Option B (8) is also not correct because 8 is two numbers less than 10, not the immediate next number. Option D (12) is not the right answer either, as 12 is two numbers more than 10, not the next number when counting backward.

questions.question_text: Count backward from 15. What are the next three numbers?

questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because they do not represent counting backward from 15. Option A (16, 17, 18) is counting forward, not backward.
